intro: Arthromeris lungtauensis var. sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim arrowhead, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its arrowhead-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a woody stem and palmate leaves with a distinctive veining pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
